title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv says Crimea strike was part of counteroffensive; air raid sirens sound across Ukraine
description: No casualties were recorded in the capital, Kyiv, as Russia launched missiles in retaliation after a weekend attack on a fuel depot in Crimea.

title: Biden courts son of Philippine dictator he once opposed
description: Ferdinand Marcos Jr. was elected president of the Philippines last year. Now he hopes to reverse his family's status as international pariahs.

title: Brazilian police probe deadly shooting on Indigenous land
description: Brazil’s federal police say they are investigating a shooting that killed one and wounded two Yanomami Indigenous people

title: Fashion designer for Russian first ladies dies
description: Russia’s most famous fashion designer, Vyacheslav Zaitsev, who dressed the country’s first ladies, has died at the age of 85

title: Pope voices willingness to return Indigenous loot, artifacts
description: Pope Francis says talks are underway to return artifacts in the Vatican Museum that were acquired from Indigenous peoples in Canada and has voiced a willingness to return other colonial-era objects in the Vatican’s collection on a case-by-case basis

title: Official: 148 Somalis evacuated from Sudan via Ethiopia
description: Scores of Somalis fleeing violence in Sudan arrived in their Horn of Africa nation on Sunday, an official said

title: Pope open to helping return Ukrainian children in Russia
description: Pope Francis says the Vatican is willing to help facilitate the return of Ukrainian children taken to Russia during the war

title: Relatives bury children killed in Russian missile attack
description: Relatives and friends cried next to coffins as they buried children and others killed in a Russian missile attack on the central Ukrainian city of Uman

title: Man kills 3, self, in dispute among Portuguese pigeon racers
description: Portuguese police say a man fatally shot three other men before turning the gun on himself

title: Emergency aid supplies reach Sudan, as fighting sputters on
description: An aircraft carrying eight tons of emergency medical supplies has landed in Sudan to help hospitals devastated by more than two weeks of fighting between forces loyal to rival generals

title: Pakistan police allege 2 clerics raped boy in seminary
description: Pakistani police say they have arrested two Muslim clerics for allegedly raping a 10-year-old boy in a religious school in eastern Punjab province

title: Pope in final Mass in Budapest urges Hungary to open doors
description: Pope Francis has urged Hungarians to open their doors to others as he wrapped up a weekend visit with a plea for an end to Russia’s war in Ukraine

title: 11 dead, 4 hospitalized in gas leak in northern India
description: Media reports in India say 11 people have died and four are hospitalized after a gas leak in northern Punjab state

title: Brits asked to swear oath to Charles III from the couch, a royal first
description: The public will be invited to join an "homage of the people" for the king in a "great cry" around the world, a new ritual invented for Charles III's coronation.

title: Chinese who reported on COVID to be released after 3 years
description: Chinese authorities are preparing to release a man who disappeared three years ago after publicizing videos of overcrowded hospitals and bodies during the COVID-19 outbreak

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia blames Ukraine for drone attack on Crimea fuel depot
description: Kyiv has not claimed responsibility for the strike. The Wagner Group's chief threatened to pull his forces out of Bakhmut if Moscow didn't send more ammunition.

title: The rise and violent demise of pro-Russian war blogger Vladlen Tatarsky
description: The killing of the blogger, whose real name was Maxim Fomin, in an explosion in St. Petersburg, showcased the role of a new cadre of propagandists in the vanguard of the Kremlin's info-wars.
